answer:
Vaccines and their ingredients are safe. Thimersol (a mecury based preservative) has been safely used in vaccines for over 80 years. Thimersol is only used in influenza (flu) vaccines that have more than one dose (multi-dose vial) to prevent bacterial or fungal growth. Your baby can receive a single dose vial of influenza vaccine does not have thimerosal in it. Learn more about influenza vaccines here. Learn more about vaccines and the safety of their ingredients here.
Immunization Nurse
question: Does the flu vaccine for babies contain mercury? Is there an alternative?
